alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:19PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Albany County through 900 PM MDT... At 818 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Evans Creek Campground, or 32 miles southwest of Laramie, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albany, Evans Creek Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Lake Owen Campground, Boswell Creek Campground, Woods Landing, Miller Lake Campground and Lake Owen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
